sub_title: Innovation & Partnerships for Sustainable Development | Transformative Innovation | Social Entrepreneur
summary:
I believe in the power of innovation and collaboration to build a fair and sustainable future for all. Over the past 12 years, I have effectively developed and facilitated projects to drive this change.

Leading and participating in diverse projects where science, technology, and innovation converge with society, my work has involved collaborating with a range of stakeholders, from national governments to civil society and the private sector. This valuable experience motivated me to pursue a Master of Science in Innovation for Sustainable International Development, which I completed as a Chevening Scholar funded by the British Government.

Also a social entrepreneur, I was a co-founder of Cirklo, the first social innovation consultancy in Latin America, working with organizations around the world to create joint social and economic value. My main role was building a network of strategic partners that would allow us to push forward the transition towards a sustainable economy.

My goal is to design and execute more impactful collaborations and innovation projects, working together with transdisciplinary and multicultural teams, to build sustainable development.

education.degree_name: MSc in Innovation for Sustainable International Development

awards.title: 3rd place #‎Hack4Humanity‬ hackathon
awards.description:
On 22-23 May, 2016, technologists, innovators, entrepreneurs, change makers, creatives and more from all over the world galvanized together in Istanbul, Turkey for the 24 hour ‪#‎Hack4Humanity‬ hackathon at the World Humanitarian Summit. Over 150 participants representing more than 30 countries united as a community to tackle some of the most challenging issues faced by global refugee crisis including translation, job creation, education and food & water provision.

Our project is Anatolia, a platform that provides children in refugee camps an opportunity to build up aspirations, knowledge and skills through a gaming experience. It empowers them to reach those aspirations, while turning them into agents of change able to help their families integrate to their fostering countries and recover hope.

To learn more about this experience, you can read  this Medium post: https://medium.com/@namilolo/what-i-learned-hacking-for-humanity-5963b53b3103

awards.title: Chevening Scholarship
awards.description: Chevening is the UK government's global awards programme. It makes awards to outstanding individuals with leadership potential from around the world to study postgraduate courses at universities in the UK.

profile_positions.description:
GRI provides the world’s most trusted and widely used standards on sustainability reporting, enabling organizations and their stakeholders to make better decisions that create social, environmental and economic benefits for everyone. Over 40 countries and regions reference GRI in their policies. 

I am part of an international team responsible for growing and nurturing the GRI Community, helping their +500 members around the globe to develop and shape the future of sustainability through transparency. I have managed the engagement with our corporate stakeholders in Australia, Austria, Germany, Mexico, Spain, Switzerland and Portugal.
profile_positions.title: Manager Corporate & Stakeholder Engagement

profile_positions.description: A platform for open conversations and engagement with practitioners of sustainable development from the Mexican diaspora. This platform was launched in February 2021 with the participation of the National Coordinator for the 2030 Agenda in the Office of the Presidency of Mexico. In September 2022 the project got funding from the British Government to develop six virtual conversations.
profile_positions.title: Creator and facilitator

profile_positions.description:
Identifying opportunities in Europe and building partnerships around innovation for sustainable development.

• In December 2019 I delivered a workshop on Transformative Innovation in Montenegro, invited by the UK Alumni Association of Montenegro
profile_positions.title: Liaison to Europe

profile_positions.location: Ciudad de México y alrededores, México
profile_positions.description:
Cirklo is a leading innovation consultancy firm in business transformation and social impact, comprised of an experienced team committed to pushing forward the transition towards a new economy. Together we create projects, services, and platforms that drive positive changes in society and the environment.

Responsibilities: 
• Position the organization among key partners and stakeholders from business, civil society, and governmental sectors locally and internationally
• Identify opportunities and design collaborations and partnerships that allow us to elevate our impact while driving systemic transformation

Primary results:
• Partnered with the Latin American Impact Investing Forum to improve the impact of their discussion panels through the creation of a Toolkit
• Partnered with the Aspen Network of Development Entrepreneurs and Micromentor to carry out When Big Meets Small, an event that seeks to facilitate connections between entrepreneurs and corporations to generate shared value
• Stablished our first collaborations with international development agencies: the German Agency for International Cooperation (GIZ) and the Mexican Agency for International Cooperation for Development (AMEXCID)
• Launched our first publication, funded by the GIZ: "La Alianza por la Sostenibilidad: un Prototipo de la AMEXCID para la Vinculación con el Sector Privado"
• Designed a methodology to align company strategies to the SDGs and help them
structure sustainable development projects
• Started a collaboration with the W.K. Kellogg Foundation, one of the largest philanthropic organizations worldwide, with Cirklo becoming the first non-American contractor in the history of the Foundation
profile_positions.title: Institutional Development Director

profile_positions.description:
Since founding Cirklo, I have been acting as Senior Innovation Strategist and Project Manager for some of the key accounts of the company.

Responsibilities
• Leading multidisciplinary project teams and partnering with clients to deliver great work and tangible results
• Building a trusting relationship with our clients, and fostering a creative and productive environment for the team

Relevant Projects
• Grupo Gentera (2015). We structured the Innovation Department and internal processes for the largest microfinance bank in Latin America, developed a methodology to launch new financial products to the market and trained their team to be ready for implementation
• Danone-Bonafont (2017). For the largest supplier of bottled water in Mexico we designed a sustainable supply chain for recycled PET, a road map to run a pilot program and a set of indicators to monitor and measure their impact
• GIZ-AMEXCID (2017-18). Funded by the German Agency for International Cooperation, we worked with 30 corporations to align four development projects to the SDGs, in the fields of quality education, affordable and clean energy, decent work and economic growth, and responsible consumption and production
• W.K. Kellogg Foundation (2018). We worked with one of the largest philanthropic organizations worldwide, to help them ensure that all their staff master the necessary mindset and skillset to live out the foundation’s vision and values around community engagement, leadership, and racial equity.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager and Senior Innovation Strategist

profile_positions.location: Ciudad de México y alrededores, México
profile_positions.description:
Cirklo was the first social innovation consulting firm in Mexico. As a co-founder, the first two years were about bootstrapping to turn our startup into a healthy growing company. After that, my responsibilities became more oriented toward business development.

Responsibilities: 
• Identify and bring to life new business opportunities
• Build long term relationships with potential clients, and turn them into joint growth
opportunities

Main results:
• Designed, negotiated and implemented projects for organizations such as Coca Cola Company, Danone, Gentera, Microsoft and Telefónica
• Sustained and exponential growth during the first five years of operations
profile_positions.title: Founding Partner | Business Development Director

profile_positions.description:
The Association gathers Mexican alumni from the Science Policy Research Unit (SPRU), a leading center of research on science, technology and innovation policy at the University of Sussex. Through diverse activities, members connect and build new personal and professional opportunities while keeping a connection with SPRU in the UK.

We organized two meetings in Mexico with the support from the British Embassy, through the Chevening Programme, and the participation of the Director and other members from SPRU. The second event was hosted by Google, and it counted with the participation of the company's Head of Public Policy & Government Affairs.

The Association is also looking to support the work that SPRU is doing with the Mexican Government as part of the Transformative Innovation Policy Consortium, a group of policymakers and funding agencies working together to give substance to a new framing for Science, Technology and Innovation policy that aims to contribute to addressing global societal challenges, as encapsulated in the United Nations' Sustainable Development Goals.
profile_positions.title: Founder & President

profile_positions.description:
Aimed at a Latin American audience, I created InnEspanish as a platform to share relevant knowledge around innovation and entrepreneurship. I managed to contact and engage in conversations with top thinkers and doers to generate relevant content.

Some of the people I interviewed:
• Bill Aulet, Managing Director of the Martin Trust Center for MIT Entrepreneurship.
• Moisés Noreña, Global Director of Innovation at Whirlpool
• Sam Pitroda, Chairman of the National Knowledge Commission of India, and Advisor to the Prime Minister of India on Public Information Infrastructure & Innovations
• Shailendra Vyakarnam, Director of the Centre for Entrepreneurial Learning of the University of Cambridge Judge Business School
• Solomon Darwin, Associate Director of the Center for Business Innovation of the Haas School of Business at Berkeley and leader of the Smart Village Movement
• Vint Cerf, “Father of the Internet” and Vice President and Chief Internet Evangelist for Google
profile_positions.title: Creator | blogger

company.name: Consultoría en Prensa y Comunicación | Investigación y Desarrollo

profile_positions.company: Consultoría en Prensa y Comunicación | Investigación y Desarrollo
profile_positions.description:
The leading medium on science, technology, and innovation (STI) journalism in Mexico. I led the launching of the first self-sustaining STI news agency in a developing country, to approach science to society.

Responsibilities: 
• Obtain initial funding for the launching of the agency
• Coordinate the strategic planning and the creation of a self-sustaining business model
• Position the agency and the company among key national and international stakeholders from the public and private sectors

Main results:
• Created a self-sustaining business model that allows the agency to keep operating up to date, sending its daily content to +200 news outlets
• Established and led conversations with the Office of Science, Technology, and Innovation of the Organization of American States (OAS), which resulted in the creation of the Inter American Scientific Journalism Program, with our company as a founding partner
• Established an agreement with the Organization of Ibero-American States for Education, Science and Culture (OEI) for the elaboration of content, and our company was invited to present the news agency during the Ibero-American Forum of Communication of Science, held in Brazil
• Established and agreement with the United States - Mexico Foundation for Science, and represented Mexico in two editions of the Innovation Journalism Conferences held at Stanford University
• Established commercial agreements with the National Council on Science and Technology (Conacyt), the ministries of Economy, Energy and Agriculture, Tec de Monterrey and Elsevier.
profile_positions.title: Liaison Coordinator

company.name: Clúster de Sustentabilidad de la Red Global MX

company.name: Red de Talentos Mexicanos en Países Bajos (Mexican Talent Network in the Netherlands)

volunteer_experiences.description:
The Mexican Talent Network in The Netherlands is a space to learn, collaborate and exchange knowledge, ideas and projects with Mexican professionals in the Netherlands.

I structured a working plan to create a Coordination on Sustainable Development that will promote sustainability and build projects and collaborations between Mexico and the Netherlands around the 2030 Agenda.
Supporting young leaders from the Enseña por México initiative to define their career plans and professional goals.
I was in charge of a group of around 40 children aged 6-15, organizing camps twice a year, and meetings every Saturday during three years.
